com.foreach.imageserver.math

Class ImageServerConversionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.imageserver.math.ImageServerConversionUtils

  • public class ImageServerConversionUtils
extends Object
    Utility methods to calculate/translate DTO instances.
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

    • Method Detail

      • calculateAspectRatio

        public static AspectRatio calculateAspectRatio(ImageResolutionDto resolutionDto)

      • calculateAspectRatio

        public static AspectRatio calculateAspectRatio(DimensionsDto dimensions)

      • extendCrop

        public static CropDto extendCrop(CropDto original,
                                 AspectRatio aspectRatio)
        This will extend an existing crop to match a given aspect ratio. The center point of the crop will be kept, so extending will happen equally on all sides involved. This can return a crop with negative x and y coordinates. Use moveToFit(CropDto, DimensionsDto) if you also want the crop to be moved about to fit it in the visible coordinates box.

        Crop parameters like source and box will be kept.

        Parameters:
        original - crop coordinates
        aspectRatio - the crop should match
        Returns:
        modified crop
        See Also:
        moveToFit(CropDto, DimensionsDto)

      • shrinkCrop

        public static CropDto shrinkCrop(CropDto original,
                                 AspectRatio aspectRatio)
        This will shrink an existing crop to match a given aspect ratio. The center point of the crop will be kept. Assuming that the original crop had valid coordinates, this will result in a valid crop.

        Crop parameters like source and box will be kept.

        Parameters:
        original - crop coordinates
        aspectRatio - the crop should match
        Returns:
        modified crop

      • moveToFit

        public static CropDto moveToFit(CropDto original,
                                DimensionsDto box)
        Will shift a crop to fit entirely inside the box. Usually used after extendCrop(CropDto, AspectRatio) to verify that the resulting extension does not surpass the box boundaries. This counters the center point based extending of a crop.

        This function will throw an exception if it is not possible to fit the crop inside the box.

        Parameters:
        original - crop coordinates
        box - the crop should fit in
        Returns:
        modified crop
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the crop dimensions are impossible to fit in the box

      • normalize

        public static DimensionsDto normalize(DimensionsDto original,
                                      DimensionsDto boundaries)
        Will calculate the unknown dimensions for the original according to the boundaries specified. Any unknown dimensions will be scaled according to the aspect ratio of the boundaries.
        Parameters:
        original - dimensions
        boundaries - for the new dimensions
        Returns:
        normalized dimensions

      • normalize

        public static DimensionsDto normalize(DimensionsDto original,
                                      AspectRatio aspectRatio)
        Will verify and modify the dimensions so that they match the aspect ratio. The resulting dimensions will never be smaller than the original one and always one of the original dimensions will be kept.
        Parameters:
        original - dimensions
        aspectRatio - to use when normalizing the dimensions
        Returns:
        normalized dimensions

      • normalize

        public static CropDto normalize(CropDto original,
                                DimensionsDto box)
        Will translate a crop to fit inside the box specified. This requires the source dimensions of the crop to be set.
        Parameters:
        original - crop
        box - to use for translating the crop coordinates
        Returns:
        normalized crop

      • scaleToFitIn

        public static DimensionsDto scaleToFitIn(DimensionsDto original,
                                         DimensionsDto box)
        Will downscale the dimensions to fit in the boundaries if they are larger.
        Parameters:
        original - dimensions
        box - that the translated dimensions should fit in
        Returns:
        translated dimensions

      • fitsIn

        public static boolean fitsIn(DimensionsDto original,
                             DimensionsDto boundaries)
        Checks if the area represented by dimensions fits inside the area defined by the box (the original area should be the same surface or smaller).
        Parameters:
        original - dimensions to check
        boundaries - that the dimensions should fit in
        Returns:
        true if dimensions fit

      • isWithinBox

        public static boolean isWithinBox(CropDto crop,
                                  DimensionsDto box)
        Checks if a crop is entirely positioned within a box. The crop dimensions should be smaller or equal to the box dimensions, and the left top coordinates should not be negative.
        Parameters:
        crop - to check
        box - that should contain the crop
        Returns:
        true if crop fits

      • calculateDistance

        public static int calculateDistance(ImageResolutionDto from,
                                    ImageResolutionDto to)

      • calculateDistance

        public static int calculateDistance(@NonNull
                                    @NonNull DimensionsDto from,
                                    @NonNull
                                    @NonNull DimensionsDto to)
        Calculates the distance between two dimensions. If the dimensions are exactly the same, the distance is 0. If the first dimensions fits entirely in the second, the distance will be positive. The larger the second dimension, the greater the distance number. If the first dimension is larger than the second dimension, the distance number will be negative. Distances closer to 0 indicate how much smaller the scond dimension is.

        A dimension is considered smaller as soon as a single side is smaller. Calculating the distance is impossible if any of the arguments have an unknown dimension.

        The actual distance number is the delta between the two surfaces. If the surface is the same (but dimensions are reversed), then the distance will be -1.

        Parameters:
        from - dimension
        to - dimension
        Returns:
        distance number
